content.description:
This is a link up traverse, and it's pretty fun. Start by clipping the first bolt of

Independence Day

(far left), then the second bolt of the next route right and then the last protection bolt of every other route until you end up at the anchors of the far right route (

Right to be Wrong

).

This line, vague as it may be, pretty much hits the crux sections of all but the last route, so it packs a bit of a pump. Try it, it's freakin' awesome.
content.protection: The first part is slightly run out, don't blow any clips, not bad though.

content.description: Just downhill from the notch, climb past three bolts with the crux at the top gaining the anchor.
content.protection:
Three bolts to a two-bolt anchor (shared with "

Independence Day

").

content.description: Climb past the first bolt to a ledge.  A short, right-facing flake/corner leads to a roof and a hard 5.10 crux.  Work up into a crack for the real crux, then step right for the anchor.
content.protection:
Four bolts to a two-bolt anchor (shared with "

Fat Democrat

").

content.description: Climb the seam to the right of the bolts.
content.protection:
Four bolts to a two-bolt anchor.  All the bolts are shared with ("

Campaign Trail

").

content.description: This route starts downhill from the tree in the gully. Belay across the gully.  Crank on a hollow flake past the first bolt for a powerful start. Chase a right-facing flake, then continue up the face past more cruxes, with the hardest crux at the top.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two-bolt anchor.

content.description: This is the leftmost line, starting out of the notch.  It is short, steep, and featured.
content.protection:
Two bolts to a two-bolt anchor (shared with "

Rock the Vote

").

content.description:
Follow the line of bolts behind the tree.  Save a bit for the top, because the crux comes between the last bolt and the anchor.  It is possible to traverse straight left and finish on "

Party Line

" for an easier, 5.11a variation.
content.protection:
Four bolts to a two-bolt anchor (shared with "

Party Line

").

content.description: Climb the seam left of the bolts.
content.protection:
Four bolts to a two bolt anchor.  The protection and the anchor are shared with "

Lady Liberty

".
